intro: Pogomesia leiocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pogomesia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
